intro: Scapiarabis, commonly known as the false dandelion, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its basal rosette of leaves and a single, tall flowering stem that bears a cluster of yellow flowers. The leaves are typically covered in a fine layer of white hairs, giving them a fuzzy appearance. The plant is native to various regions in Europe and Asia and is often found in disturbed soils and open habitats. Scapiarabis species are generally herbaceous and can be identified by their distinctive floral structure and leaf morphology.
